What does the result of an operation in Verus contain?
The result of an operation in Verus contains an "operationid" which is a string that can be used to retrieve the status of the operation using the "z_getoperationstatus" command.

#### Result:
1. "operationid"     (string) An operationid to pass to z_getoperationstatus to get the result of the operation.
2. If (returntxtemplate) is true  
```json
 {
  "outputtotals" : {currencyvaluemap}  Total outputs in all currencies the need to be input to the transaction
  "hextx" : "hexstring"         The transaction with all specified outputs and no inputs
 }
```
What additional information is returned if "returntxtemplate" is set to true in an operation result?

If "returntxtemplate" is set to true, the operation result will also contain a JSON object with two properties: "outputtotals" and "hextx". "outputtotals" is a currency value map that represents the total outputs in all currencies that need to be input to the transaction. "hextx" is a hexadecimal string that represents the transaction with all specified outputs and no inputs.

#### Result:
1. "operationid"     (string) An operationid to pass to z_getoperationstatus to get the result of the operation.
2. If (returntxtemplate) is true  
```json
 {
  "outputtotals" : {currencyvaluemap}  Total outputs in all currencies the need to be input to the transaction
  "hextx" : "hexstring"         The transaction with all specified outputs and no inputs
 }
```
